description.narrative: The main reason for launching the project is a need to address the group of children which were leastbenefited from the reform of the Child Care System implemented in 2007-2012 in Moldova. Accordingto the evaluation report of the Child Care Reform Strategy commissioned by Unicef and written byPeter Evans1 there are 2 groups of children who have been ?marginalized? by the reform: Childrenunder 3 years old and Children with disabilities (all ages).The project contributes to the extension of the child care sys tem reform in the Northern part of theRepublic of Moldova namely in Balti and in 13 northern and central counties. The main objectives ofthe project are to build capacity of local child protection structures (in Northern parts of Moldova) inorder to preven t unnecessary separation of children under 3 years old and to identify family solutionsfor children living in institutions. The project also aims for developing new services to provide supportto the Child Protection System.Within the project implementation in Balti CCF Moldova uses the approach which is implemented andproven to be successful in the similar work of the organization in Chisinau. The methodologycomprises: the assessment of children and their families, the decision jointly taken with guardiansh ipauthorities about the best protection form for each child in institution, implementation of this planincluding family support offered based on assessment the best protection forms for children (based onUN CRC UN Guidelines for Alternative care and Moldov an Family Code) namely reintegration inbiological family placement in extended family adoption (in-country) placement in foster care and ifall of the above excluded placement in small placement centers or residential institution.
